metadata.description: This JSON contains all molecules with SMILES errors that need correction

molecules_needing_correction.name: Kobalamin (B12)
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SEVERELY INCOMPLETE SMILES - represents only nucleoside fragment, missing entire corrinoid ring system
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Cobalamin (B12) is one of the most complex naturally occurring molecules. The provided SMILES represents <3% of the actual structure. This needs complete research and reconstruction from chemical databases.
molecules_needing_correction.action: MUST RESEARCH - Do not guess. Use PubChem or chemical reference.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Koensym Q10
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SEVERELY TRUNCATED SIDE CHAIN - Missing ~40 carbons from isoprenyl tail
molecules_needing_correction.notes: CoQ10 (Ubiquinone-10) has 10 isoprenyl units creating a 50-carbon side chain. Current SMILES only shows ~19 carbons.
molecules_needing_correction.action: EXTEND SIDE CHAIN - Add remaining isoprenyl units (C50 tail)

molecules_needing_correction.name: Cellulose
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows glucose (C6H12O6) not cellulose monomer (C6H10O5)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Cellulose is polysaccharide of glucose minus water (dehydration). Single glucose is C6H12O6, cellulose repeat is C6H10O5. Shown is cellobiose which is the repeating dimer.
molecules_needing_correction.action: USE CELLOBIOSE or other disaccharide representation

molecules_needing_correction.name: Hemiacetal
molecules_needing_correction.source: Example hemiacetal with correct formula C4H8O2
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Hemiacetal functional group where OH and OR are bonded to same carbon. Current SMILES is cyclohexanol derivative.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Amid
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows acetamide (C2H5NO), formula requires C3H7NO
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Current SMILES is primary amide (acetamide). To match formula C3H7NO, need secondary amide with methyl on N.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Karbamat
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows carbamate anion, formula shows ethyl carbamate/urethane
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Formula C2H5NO2 suggests ethyl carbamate (urethane) not bare carbamate group.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Disulfid
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows C2H6S2 (dimethyl disulfide) but formula requires C4H10S2 (diethyl disulfide)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: CCSSC is only dimethyl. Need CCCSCC for C4H10S2.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Sulfon
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows SO2 (sulfur dioxide) not dimethyl sulfone
molecules_needing_correction.notes: O=S=O is pure SO2. C2H6O2S is dimethyl sulfone with two methyl groups on sulfur.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Izocyanat
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows methyl isocyanate (C2H3NO), formula shows bare isocyanate (CHNO)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Either formula is wrong (should be C2H3NO) or SMILES should show bare -N=C=O. Current SMILES is correct for methyl isocyanate.
molecules_needing_correction.action: UPDATE FORMULA to C2H3NO for methyl isocyanate

molecules_needing_correction.name: Tiocyanat
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows methyl thiocyanate (C2H3NS), formula shows bare thiocyanate (CHNS)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Similar issue to Izocyanat. SMILES is methyl thiocyanate C2H3NS.
molecules_needing_correction.action: UPDATE FORMULA to C2H3NS for methyl thiocyanate

molecules_needing_correction.name: Azo
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES structure (C22H17N3O5) completely different from formula (C12H10N2)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: The complex SMILES shows a diaryl ether with cyanide, not azobenzene. Simple azobenzene is C12H10N2.
molecules_needing_correction.action: REPLACE with simple azobenzene or update formula to match complex structure

molecules_needing_correction.name: Nitro
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows nitrite ion (NO2-) but formula shows nitrobenzene (C6H5NO2)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Completely different molecules. SMILES is inorganic nitrite, formula is organic aromatic nitro compound.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Sulfonamid
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES has 1 N (benzenesulfonamide), formula requires 2 N atoms
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Formula shows C6H8N2O2S (2 nitrogens) but SMILES shows 1 nitrogen. Need secondary sulfonamide with N-methyl.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Fosfonat
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows methylphosphonic acid (CH5O3P), formula requires ethylphosphonic acid (C2H7O3P)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Current SMILES has 1 carbon (methyl), need 2 carbons (ethyl).
molecules_needing_correction.action: EXTEND side chain from methyl to ethyl

molecules_needing_correction.name: Fosfat ester
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows dimethyl phosphate (C2H7O4P), formula requires C3H9O4P (ethyl methyl phosphate)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Current SMILES has 2 carbons total, need 3 carbons total.

molecules_needing_correction.name: Siloksan
molecules_needing_correction.issue: SMILES shows C5H16O2Si2 (5 carbons, 2 oxygens) but formula claims C4H12OSi2 (4 carbons, 1 oxygen)
molecules_needing_correction.notes: Mismatch between SMILES and formula. Either add methyl group or fix formula.
molecules_needing_correction.action: Either UPDATE FORMULA to C5H16O2Si2 OR replace final O with C
